meanings.definition: To cover or line the ceiling of a room.
meanings.sent1: I will ceil the ceiling with beautiful wallpaper.
meanings.sent2: The workers will ceil the ceiling with wooden panels.
meanings.sent3: The family decided to ceil the ceiling with glow-in-the-dark stars for a fun touch.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to ceil the room, filling it with joy.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight streamed through the window, making the ceiling ceil with brightness.

meanings.definition: The inner roof of a room.
meanings.sent1: The ceil of the room was painted a calming blue.
meanings.sent2: A chandelier hung from the ceil, casting a warm glow.
meanings.sent3: The spider made its home in the corner of the ceil, much to the surprise of the residents.
meanings.sent4: The ceil seemed to hug the room, creating a cozy atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The ceil showed signs of water damage, needing urgent repair.
